lead_paragraph: An article last Sunday about the veteran golfers who set the pace at the Masters through three rounds referred incorrectly, in some editions, to Kenny Perry, the 48-year-old who was tied for the lead. Greg Norman was 53 when he held the lead of the 2008 British Open at the same point; Perry was not the oldest man with at least a piece of the lead after 54 holes of a major championship.
